mods.abstract: Longview of court of Amenhotep III, Temple of Amen at Luxor, East Thebes (New Kingdom Dynasty XVIII); extensive lotiform captial colonnade built during Amenhotep III's reign, ca. 1388-1351 B.C.E., Egyptian man and his donkey among ruins (foreground); pylon and single obelisk (background); "106 (Luxor) Colonnes d'Amenhotep III (XVII dyn) Phot. Art. G. Lekegian & Co" in white along bottom of print. (Number on object is 21/655).

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
